page.title: 10Marston, Buildings
page.content: The church of St. Mary is a noteworthy building with a separate tower 50 feet away.Legend has it that it was thrown there by the devil, but it does have thick walls, a 1st storey door and a well inside implying it may have been defensive. The old Marston and Lidlington School in the village was built in 1847.Today it is a Grade 2 Listed building and was owned by Target Craft (archery) after it ceased use as a school.Since September 1985 it has been converted into The Village School Residential Home for the Elderly.Additional buildings have been added to form a courtyard at the back to provide accommodation for 20 residents who are cared for by 17 staff- many employed from the village.The Rectory building has a moat and the only surviving dovehouse in the parish.
